au.com.codeka.carrot

Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.codeka.carrot.Scope

  • public class Scope
extends java.lang.Object
    Scope is a collection of all the bindings that are active. The scope is basically a stack: each time you iterate down a node, you can push new bindings onto the stack and those will be the first one searched for a variable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scope(Bindings globalBindings)
      Create a new Scope, with the given initial set of "global" bindings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void extendCurrent(Bindings bindings)
      Extend the current bindings with the given one.
      void pop()
      Pop the most recent bindings off the stack.
      void push(Bindings bindings)
      Push the given bindings onto the stack.
      java.lang.Object resolve(java.lang.String name)
      Resolve the given named variable from the stack of bindings, most recently-pushed to last.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Scope

        public Scope(Bindings globalBindings)
        Create a new Scope, with the given initial set of "global" bindings.
        Parameters:
        globalBindings - A set of "global" bindings that you want first on the stack.

        Push the given bindings onto the stack.
        Parameters:

      • pop

        public void pop()
        Pop the most recent bindings off the stack.

      • resolve

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Object resolve(@Nonnull
                                          java.lang.String name)
        Resolve the given named variable from the stack of bindings, most recently-pushed to last.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to resolve.
        Returns:
        The resolved value, or null if the value doesn't exist in this scope.
